pullRequest.body:
Shortcut definition that doesn't require the generalization to any `NormedSpace` over such a field

Shake the p-adic proper space proof.


---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

#### Declarations diff

`+ ProperSpace.of_nontriviallyNormedField_of_weaklyLocallyCompactSpace`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

Maybe it would be a good idea to add a note to the module-level docstring, or the docstring of the lemma, (or both), to clarify why you're doing this: that this is a special case of results from `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Module.FiniteDimension` but the direct proof requires many fewer imports. (Otherwise someone might try to "refactor" it back to the way it was before...)

Looks good to me, thanks!

maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.
bors d+

:v: pechersky can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10890078812/job/30218034302)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10890078812/job/30218034614)
This is nice, good to simplify the imports. Just a few minor nitpicks.
This sentence seems a bit unclear, please rewrite.
`convert` is often quite slow, is there any nice way of avoiding it here?
I'm using convert as a stand in for the absence of isCompact.mul_const. The unification of mul against smul with a scalar of the field itself should be pretty fast.

You're right, this step is indeed quite fast; but the proof as a whole is slow (2.5 sec on my machine). Investigating with `set_option trace.profiler true` it seems that the slowness is coming from the `simp`s. Squeezing these to `simp only` gets it down to 0.7s which is much more reasonable.

At this point the goal is `closedBall 0 (‖c‖ ^ n * r) = c ^ n • closedBall 0 r`. Generalising to replace `c ^ n` with an arbitrary element of `𝕜`, this looks like a lemma worth having in its own right (& maybe for normed vector spaces over normed fields, or even normed modules over normed rings, not just for normed fields themselves)
We do have the more general result, but it lives in NormedSpace.Pointwise which I was trying to avoid importing.
In fact, this proof comes from the more general result about ProperSpace over NormedSpaces by Yury, where it's really the smul result that has changed in proof.

```suggestion
  have hC (n) : IsCompact (closedBall (0 : 𝕜) (‖c‖^n * r)) := by
```
(slightly nicer syntax for `have` with parameters)
Minor nitpick: your name has the instance arguments listed in the opposite order from how they appear.
You could (entirely optional) add some `assert_not_exists` statements here that would defend against import creep. Only if it makes sense.
And it would be excellent to add at least one `assert_not_exists` statement here, based on what you've just removed.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Analysis/Normed/Field): ProperSpace of WeaklyLocallyCompact
